description: This object describes how to access a file. This could either be a destination or a source based on where it is used.

path.description: The path to a file (remember if this is a destination it does not have to exist yet. IMPORTANT NOTE: I base the protocol off of the prefix so make sure to specify it properly. For example, for ftp use 'ftp://' then the path.

username.description: The username to use for accessing this location. This would make sense when accessing an FTP site but not when copying a file locally.

password.description: The password to use for accessing this location. This would make sense when accessing an FTP site but not when copying a file locally.
